content: A cluster of “kettle lakes” west of Minneapolis, Minnesota. The Great Lakes and the lakes in Minnesota were formed as glaciers receded during the last ice age.  Approximately 15,000 years ago to about 9,000 years ago, glaciers alternately retreated and advanced over the landscape, carving out holes and leaving behind ice chunks…Lakes formed in this way are called kettle lakes__no.0561, 2020.  #kettlelakes #iceage
